a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x + 5"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = -3 * x + 8"
shows  "\<forall> x. P x - Q x = 5 * x - 3"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $(2x+5)-(-3x+8)$. The final Answer is 5x-3
 ### Proof
 We have $$(2x+5)-(-3x+8)=2x+5+3x-8=(2x+3x)+(5-8)=\boxed{5x-3}.$$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x + 5"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = -3 * x + 8"
shows  "\<forall> x. P x - Q x = 5 * x - 3"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: If $P(x) = 2x + 5$ and $Q(x) = -3x + 8$, then for all $x$, $P(x) - Q(x) = 5x - 3$.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x + 5"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g x = -3 * x + 8"
shows  "\<forall> x. f x - g x = 5 * x - 3"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $(2x+5)-(-3x+8)$. The final Answer is 5x-3
 ### Proof
 We have $$(2x+5)-(-3x+8)=2x+5+3x-8=(2x+3x)+(5-8)=\boxed{5x-3}.$$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and f g :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * x + 5"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. g x = -3 * x + 8"
shows  "\<forall> x. f x - g x = 5 * x - 3"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Find the difference between the functions $f(x) = 2x + 5$ and $g(x) = -3x + 8$ for all real numbers $x$. The final result should be $5x - 3$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x + 5"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = -3 * x + 8"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = P x - Q x"
shows  "\<forall> x. R x = 5 * x - 3"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Simplify $(2x+5)-(-3x+8)$. The final Answer is 5x-3
 ### Proof
 We have $$(2x+5)-(-3x+8)=2x+5+3x-8=(2x+3x)+(5-8)=\boxed{5x-3}.$$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and P Q R :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. P x = 2 * x + 5"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. Q x = -3 * x + 8"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. R x = P x - Q x"
shows  "\<forall> x. R x = 5 * x - 3"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: Given the functions $P(x) = 2x + 5$, $Q(x) = -3x + 8$, and $R(x) = P(x) - Q(x)$, simplify the expression for $R(x)$. The final answer is $R(x) = 5x - 3$.

a_5.formal problem:

 ### Proof
 We have $$(2x+5)-(-3x+8)=2x+5+3x-8=(2x+3x)+(5-8)=\boxed{5x-3}.$$
 *)

and h1 : "b = -3*x + 8"
shows  "a - b = 5*x - 3"
 proof-
